critique: The document is an executive order delegating authority to the Secretary of State regarding international assistance programs. As the President, the primary emotion I want to elicit is a sense of confidence and assurance that the government is functioning effectively and addressing important global issues. The tone is formal and authoritative, reflecting the seriousness of the matter. There is an element of hope associated with providing assistance to children and countries in need. There is no explicit mention of negative emotions such as sadness, anger, fear, or disgust. Surprise is not a relevant emotion in this context.
